msg: Removed some methods.  See TRaX list for details.
Fixed some stuff pertaining to xsl:import.
Fixed some stuff mainly pertaining to xsl:import, but also the document() function.
Needed to support whitespace lists with xsl:import.
Use getParent instead of getXMLReader, as per comments on TRaX list.
Use Xerces URI class.
Remove references to java URL class.
Use getAbsoluteURI instead of getURLFromString.
Use Strings instead of URL objects.
Use SystemIDResolver instead of duplicated code.
Use Strings instead of URLs.
Make extension functions basically work.  I haven't yet tried extension elements.  Implementation of LiveConnect style of Java method resolution.
Addition of MethodResolver.
Moved XPath up a package to become a sibling of Xalan package.  XPath no longer directly uses the opcodes, but is 'compiled' into a fast expression tree.

msg: no message
Ant build file with support for compile, jar, and javadoc targets.
Support for using Ant to build Xalan-J 2.0
Javadoc doclet
Only allow for one context marker in the global space.
Load properties file
Make methods getStylesheetRoot and getLocator public
All examples except exampleUseAssociated now work in Xalan.  (Except the current examples use the Xerces serializers, instead of the TrAX API.)
Added loadPropertyFileToSystem(String file) for auto loading of properties file.  Need to come up with non-xalan location for file default location.
Added loadPropertyFileToSystem(String file) for auto loading of properties file.  Need to come up with non-xalan location for file default location.  Began support for getAssociatedStylesheets.
For support of xml-stylesheet PI.
Moved setPreserveSpace(false); in setIndent(boolean) to setPreserveSpace(!on); in setIndenting( boolean on ).
For cloned OutputFormat in getOutputFormat, use OutputFormatExtended so I can deal with that silly preserve space stuff.

If a start element is found when no start document has occured, force a start document.  This is needed, for the moment, for those cases of chaining transforms when a start document event is not fired.  This should be fixed so that the transform creates the startDocument() event.
Support getFeature for the TrAX features.
loadPropertyFileToSystem moved to TrAX.
Added StylesheetPIHandler.

Begin cleaning up Xalan-J 2.x Ant makefile
Attempt to separate compile targets; up -mx memory temporarily
since we're compiling the whole tree at once...
More infrastructure for Xalan-J 2.0 doc
Enable multi-threading of processor and transformer
no message
Derive from UnImplNode, delete read-only methods.
Add some Attr methods so DTMProxy can derive.
Push and pop the template for TransformerClient support.
Implement TransformerClient interface.
Test for TransformerClient, and call setTransformState if so.
Add TransformerClient and TransformState.
Check in compatibility layer to xalan 1.x.

msg: Begin using Ant 1.1 released version; need excludesfile functionality
Fix test for number of parameters
Fix problem with the stylesheet locator stack. Was not being popped.
Add an entry in XSLTSchema for xsl attributes to be ignored in LRE output
Checked in by accident!!!
Fix exclude-result-prefixes for LREs
In progress...
No real changes, I think.
Fixed bug where the argNum was not correctly passed to the extended class.
In progress... working on function overloading, and integration with ExtensionContext object.
Added constructor so Locator would be set.  Also, fix error handling bug.
Coment out LOCATIONPATHEX stuff, so no one will use it.
Add getArgLength method.
Fix problem with variable not being handled right.
No real change.
Fixed error handling bugs.
Fixed javadoc comment.
Implement ExpressionContext.
In progress.  Working on function overloading stuff.
Add to parent stylesheet.
No real changes.
Try to make it possible to handle unparented nodes, at least to a point.
Check for parent being null before getting the public and system ids.  Needed because they may be accessed before construction is complete.
Changed JavaDoc comment.
Fixed error handling.
Added ExpressionContext.java

Patch attributed to Gary L Peskin <garyp@firstech.com>, two DTMProxy objects compare equal if they
refer to the same node number in different documents (as can happen when
using the document() function).  This code corrects that problem.return
Tweaked stuff enough so that function extensions seem to basicaly work.  Needs lots more work, and then testing.
Put getLength method back! should not have been renamed!
Back out the previous change
Allow one or two arguments in function document
Use instruction template to create the xpath.
Derive from UnImplNode, which fixes problem with missing hasAttributes method.
Process xsl:extension-element-prefixes to create ElemExtensionCall instead of LRE.
Add proper xsl:extension-element-prefixes property, same as in Stylesheet.
Lazy processing of extension props.  More needed, I think.
Fix problems with calling extension elements, method overloading.  More work to come...
Check for null locator.
Fixed bug with result fragments compare to string.
Fixed * handling so it matches namespaced elements and attributes.
Pass qname to setAttributeNS instead of local name.
Add getOutputFormat, add executeChildTemplates varient that accepts a ContentHandler, for extension support.
Check is attribute is null in getAttribute.
No real changes.
Fix bug when extension elements are non-static methods, by not setting isClass to true if class: is not present.
Allow passing of RTFs as DocumentFragments.
Implement what was commented out.  Should work OK now.
Fix generate-id() so that it works with DTM an so it uses hex string for negative values (attribution to "Sergei S. Ivanov" <ivanoff@aha.ru>).
Allow for default decimal-format declaration

Minor updates for Xalan-J 2.0- Ant build.xml
Added excludes files for compat.jar
Removed setProps, which is no longer needed.
Xalan-J 2.0- Ant build.sh for UNIX-land
xalan-j 2.0 sample app.

msg:
Added workarounds for inability of applet to get trax, sax, and serializer system properties.
See newProcessorInstance() and transform().
Turn on validation.

1. Repackaged sample servlet as "servlet": makes build process
a lot more sensible.
2. samples/Servlet seems to have disappeared from repository,
so whatever has happened, have put into a new directory
named samples/servlet (lowercase) to match package name.

msg:
1. Added support for building samples (xalansamples.jar and xalanservlet.jar)
2. Added preliminary support for building distribution.
3. Modified javadocs target to include private and protected API.
Will change back to public after alpha.
Xalan-j 2.0  sample extensions. not all working yet.

msg: Added extensions to samples target.
Fix construction of a URI.
Back out the previous fix. The bug is somewhere else...
Major fixes for source tree caching, and fix for URL resolution.  Still a work in progress
Comment out debug diagnostics.
Add the document to the cache... may be a temporary solution to the larger issue about which thread the parse should be on.
Make to work with new source tree manager stuff.
Another take on URIResolver
Miscellaneous fixes for ID and key.
Add StreeDOMBuilder
Xalan SQL Library.  A work in progress, with limited ability.  Heavily under-commented.

msg: Minor changes for SQL extension library support... namely the addition of support of the NodeSetFilter interface.
Change the order in which return values are processed, so that NodeIterators take precidence over Nodes, if the same object implements both interfaces.
Handle case (badly) when NodeIterator is not a ContextNodeList.
Add accessors for namespace and local name, for support of extensions.
New interface allows a node to know the nodetest before getFirstChild and getNextSibling are called.
Spit out some diagnostics to System.out for right now... better than nothing for the moment.  Needs to be fixed.
Add setEntityResolver.
Check for ClassCastExceptions, and delegate to superclass if they occur.
Check for EmptyStackException.
Check for zero args.
Added files for sql extension.

Segregated samples and servlet so can build samples without worrying
about additional classpath requirements for servlet.
Fixes that bring this example closer to working.
Fix ancestor match pattern processing
Don't do URL absolutization... wait to see if the EntityResolver wants to do it.
Add processFromNode(Node node, String systemID) function.
If we're processing from a DOM tree, the Locator will be null... so create a dummy locator to make folks happy.
Use URLResolver and Entity resolver in parse.  Bottleneck parsing for both xsl:import and xsl:include.
Defensive check for null locator.
Use DOMHelper to process namespaced attributes.
Use DOMHelper to process namespaced elements.
Get rid of duplicate xml source used for 2 examples

Add processFromNode(Node node, String systemID)
, also set/getEntityResolver.
For exampleDOM2DOM, use processFromNode to create stylesheet.

Changed 2nd arg for sample extension elements to generic
ogr.w3c.dom.Element.
Initialize character array if necessary
This is as a result of previous fix. They should be checked out together.
Added the ability to get the originating node from a ElemTemplateElement, if the stylesheet was created via a DOM.  For tooling support.
Some editorial cleanup.
Reversed the incorrect isAssignableFrom expressions -- left/right problem, probably caused by dyslexia.
Fix for getAttribute in ElemExtensionCall.

Fixed servlet target to create destination dir before trying to put
output there.

1. Modified DefaultApplyXSLTProperties to use 1.1 API
  ( i.e.,  not the require 1.2)
2. Updated ApplyXSLTListener to extend xalan 2 DefaultErrorHandler.
Fix misc. typos, fix warning, fix misc stuff related with recomposing imported and included stylesheets, fix getting URI for imported/included stylesheets
Implement NamedNodeMap and getAttributes.
Use transform() instead of transformNode() to perform transformation.
Reverse the order of the parse thread vs. the transform thread... the transform thread needs to be the main thread, and the parse needs to be the child thread.
If getContentType)( returns null, set ContentType to "text/html"
improved getContentType() to use output method.
For "text" output method, set ContentType to "text/plain"
Miscellaneous fixes for imported and included stylesheets, xsl-applyImport and xsl-applyTemplate
Fixed incremental rendering for the sql extension.
Implement method getLocalName()
Added DOMOrder and NodeConsumer
Fixed problems with ResultTreeFragment traversal, ResultTreeFrag is now derived from StreeDOMHelper.
Create a vector for namespace aliases.
Set context node before sorting.

I am actually checking in code to check for a null array of iterators. But found some other code that Scott must have written on my machine, I don't remember what it was for, but I'll check it in as well.
When primary sort key fails, do not sort on secondary
Checking this in for Joe Kesselman: Fix for EntityRefs.
Fix ant.home property (bindir should be below it)
Added autodist target for use by automated build processes
Need to handle nodes from different documents differently
Error message for empty nodeset
Handle empty nodeset as second argument of document function
Error if have an AVT in select attribute of xsl:sort.
writeslot addressing
Catch invalid attribute values for xsl:sort
Now works without requiring DOM input.
SAX2SAX sample
Added compiling of SAX2SAX sample
1st draft
doc infrastructure files
doc infrastructure dtds and stylesheets from xml-site.
Set default values for Infinity and NaN for formatNumber
Apply attribute sets from imported stylesheets.
partial 1st drafts
no message
Don't ignore invalid xsl elements.
Make sure required attributes are defined
Error if have two templates with same name and import precedence
Allow LREs in a stylesheet element.
Always call getSourceTreeHandler.Characters(...)
Check for null attribute and improve performance
Error if have two templates with same name and import precedence
Check for null stylesheet root
Update/create all targets needed for basic Xalan-J 2.x builds
allow xsl:param in LREs
Initialize m_firstWalker
Typo: wrong class name
Editorial updates.

Added support for including Scott's TRaX "Patterns Design" in
the Javadoc (transform patterns.xml and copy trax.gif).

Added support for including Scott's TRaX "Patterns Design" in
the Javadoc (transform patterns.xml and copy trax.gif).
Updated contents of xalanonly-styledocs (not to be purged in a "clean").
Editorial updates for javadoc
Editorial updates for javadoc
Editorial updates for javadoc

In createDocument, use the JAVA API for XML Parsing 1.0 to
create a DOM Document node.
Don't implement StreeDOMHelper.createDocument, use super's method instead (experemental).
Implement getOwnerDocument.
Use DocumentBuilder and plain old DocumentFragment for the RTF, in transformToRTF.  I don't think ResultTreeFrag is used anymore...

Stylebook that works with Xalan-J 2.
Only change: Xalan2Processor replaces XalanProcessor in the
org.apache.stylebook.processor package.
Compiled with Xalan-J-2 (including TRaX) and current Xerces-J
(including javax.xml.parsers) on the classpath.

Revised build docs to work with a new version of Stylebook
that uses Xalan-J 2. The new Stylebook jar is
stylebook-1.0-b3_xalan-2.jar
and it is in xml-xalan/java/bin.
Fix problem with a match pattern like id()//node() and for document('a',/)
Editorial updates
May need to wait for endDocument before we can get element by id
Fix wild card matches and scores of match patterns with a predicate
docs target -- look for xalan.jar in ./build
Make sure attribute nodes are not matching node() for match patterns.
Back out last change. Checked in by accident...
rellatively complete 1st draft for xalan-j 2.

msg: Editorial updates
Make resource bundle thread safe.
Make resource bundle thread safe.
ApplyXPath ported from Xalan-Java 1.
conditionaly serialize XPath result.
Added apache license
Added AppplyXPath sample to samples target
Added introductory info on XPathAPI and the ApplyXPath sample.

synthetic.Class: IBM-developed "reverse reflection" wrappers,
used in the compiled-Template experiment. These are
also experimental and are known to have some holes, and
for the simple compilations now being attempted they don't
have huge advantages over generating directly into a stringbuffer,
but I had 'em on hand and we've been planning to publish 'em anyway.

synthetic.Class: IBM-developed reverse-reflection experiment, used in the compiled-Template experiment.
Incomplete but I had 'em on hand and have been meaning to publish anyway.
Arguably overkill for current compilation code, but may simplify later work.

Just the start of an experiment in compiling stylesheets to Java.
Only handles ElemTemplate and ElemLiteralElement at this time;
other nodes continue to run interpreted. Generated code is
not yet efficient, nor serializable, nor (sigh) reeentrant; working
on all those issues. Currently relies on a routine in BSF to invoke
the Java compiler; we should probably adopt that into
synthetic.Class.

To try it out, change the trax.processor.xslt to
org.apache.xalan.processor.CompiledStylesheetProcessor

It does pass our regression tests; the only known differences are
in attribute order.
Fixed known reentrancy problem; CompiledTemplates should now be runnable in multiple threads.
(Minor cleanup)

1. Added XConnection constructors so can use any of DriverManager
getConnection() methods: just a dbURL, dbURL with protocol,
dbURL with userID and password.
2. Updated the Javadoc comments and added a package-level doc.

New bsf.jar replaces old bsf.jar and bsfengine.jar -- and works
with Rhino 1.5 js.jar for Javascript extensions.
Make getStringType method protected to make it visible for biuilding error messages
Try to fix problem with text nodes being output on the root
New processor version

Submitted by: Gary L Peskin <garyp@firstech.com>
Reviewed by: Scott Boag
Gary cleaned up the code a bit and added
some short comments to explain the various fields.  Also, he renamed
m_mustFlushStartDoc, which made no sense to him, to m_haveDocContent.  He
ended up pulling out the newly added code which wasn't necessary and
moved some code around to where it made more sense and also worked
correctly in all cases.
Fixed bad headers.
Use hasChildNode instead of getChildCount in getFirstChild. Better for MultiThreading.
Allow processing of all key declarations at once.
Disallow recursive key calls
Make sure we math nodes on wildcard pattern

Rewrote Pipe to show series of transformations with each
Transformer functioning as ContentHandler for previous
Transformer in the series. Moved what was Pipe to
Use XMLFilters

What used to be "Pipe." Rewrote Pipe to show series of transformations with each
Transformer functioning as ContentHandler for previous
Transformer in the series.

msg: Fix references to old packagename
Latest BSF jar
Changed com.ibm.bsf to com.ibm.cs for latest BSF jar.
Added Joe's compiler and synthetic classes

Node-set extension functions: intersection, difference, distinct,
and hasSameNodes.
Fix threading problem for elements with attributes
OOps! Forgot to change this back!!!
Work in progress for Xalan-J 2 alpha release.
Changing this to avoid calling getAttrCount recursively
Make sure we don't match root and attribute nodes for wildcard match patterns.
A root match has a score of 0.5
Ignore invalid attributes

Removed white space nodes to get around a problem Stylebook
is having. When it scans "book" for "external" elements, once
to generate .jpg files, the other time to generate img refs, it counts
the whitespace nodes differently (position() retrurns a different
value).

Removed Xerces dependencies, in prep for Xerces2.
    Use JAXP for DOM parser.
    For now, duplicated Xerces URI code.
    Created org.apache.xml.serialize.transition package
       (See note to xalan-dev list.  This involves serialize.* interfaceing, whitespace handling mods, more...)
Fixed tracking of whitespace stripping.
Fixed interfacing to serializers for bypassing escaping.

msg: Check for "key(" as opposed to just "key"
Use full name when creating element
start element before processing namespace attribute
Make sure waiting queue of walkers is cleared during a reset
Return the actual prefix, not xmlns.
Removed DTM refs.
Needed for HTML serialization.
Useful comment

Added serializer, sax, dom, jaxp to javadoc and added targets for
compiling those packages.
Hmm... this should have been in last night...
Added a (non-xslt) property for the indent amount.
Added accessors for the Writer and OutputStream.
jview doesn't seem to like SerializerFactory.class.getClassLoader().loadClass, so I just do Class.forName instead.
Mainly changes for linefeed normalization.  Pretty ugly... I need to come back and revisit these, and probably put them at a higher level.
Fixes for Literal Result Element as Stylesheet, and for general HTML handling and defaults.
Ongoing work for extensions, esp. the component/script elements.  Not done yet.  Also, fixed problem with class loading in jview in the serialize package.
Addition of classes to process extension decls.
remove final object
Added org.apache.xml.serialize.transition to compile.serialize and javadocs.
Added org.apache.xml.serializeRemoved target using xalan-j 1 for docs.

Java extension functions and elements, including component\script, should now have basic functionality... more to do.  Also, put defensive code in ResultTreeHandler flush pending, when switching serializers.
Added additional defensive code in flushPending for null outputStream.
Updated to use new serializer packages in xml-xalan tree.
Fix namespace processing. Make sure parents are processed first and that an element's namespace is ouput.
Fix namespace processing. Make sure parents' prefixes are processed first
Make sure default namespace is recognized in excluded prefixes list
Do number formatting here instead of using java.text.DecimalFormat
Removed some options that don't make sense for Xalan2.

Removed org.apache.xalan.xslt and org.apache.xalan.xpath
from javadocs target.
Make sure we issue error messages!
The extension mechanism should be working relativly OK now.  Also provide NodeSet conversion for iterators and RTFs.

C;leanup -- removed SimpleRedirect since makes more sense to run
with org.apache.xalan.xslt.Process (like the other extension samples).
Cleanup
Removed the stack trace in loadPropertyFileToSystem.
Account for buffer flush with linefeeds of two chars.
Check for duplicate nodes when adding elements
Make sure we use resolved URI when looking for documents

Submitted by: Davanum Srinivas <dims@yahoo.com>
Reviewed by: Scott Boag <scott_boag@lotus.com>

Class.forName() has to be called only if isClass flag is on in
ExtensionFunctionHandler.java

Submitted by: Sebastien Sahuc <ssahuc@imediation.com>
Reviewed by: Scott Boag <scott_boag@lotus.com>

Override SetParent so that the parent's content handler is set to the source tree handler, for XMLFilter usage.
Oops, forgot to remove the class.forName above the check for isClass.
Handle xsl elements from an unsupported XSL version.
Fixed problem with resolving namespaces for DOM transformations.

Submitted by: Davanum Srinivas <dims@yahoo.com>
Reviewed by: Scott Boag

Make explicit selectNodeIterator and selectNodeList functions.
Call selectNodeIterator instead of selectNodeList function.

replaced dom.reldir with w3c.reldir whic includesprg.w3c.xslt
as well as org.w3c.dom.

replaced dom.reldir with w3c.reldir whic includesprg.w3c.xslt
as well as org.w3c.dom.
Also replaced compile.dom with compile.w3c which now includes
org.w3c.dom and org.w3c.xslt.
Removed merge error.
Added UseXMLFilters to samples target.
Factoring out boilerplate
Fixed extension handling for redirect.  Also, added encodings.
Oops, let a println in.
Call superclass's getLocalNameOfNode if n.getLocalName() returns null.  There seem to be legit cases where this can occur.
Make sure we're using .cs.JavaUtils, not .bsf.JavaUtils (claim was made that wrong one was checked in)

1.1-redir.xsl -- Editorial fix
2. MyCounter.java -- Changed Hashtable to static.Extnsion now works!

Adopt the javac-invoking code into synthetic.*. (Break BSF
dependency, prepare for some generalizations.)
Made DocumentBuilderFactory namespace aware.
Make sure nextNode is only called once in sort processing
Tolerate '\' chars.
Clip off "file:" from "file:xxx".  Hack to workaround problem with URI class.
Simple RuntimeException that wraps other exceptions, for difficult throws, mainly out of DOM functions.
Much improved error reporting, catch clauses consolodated.
Synch with TransformerImpl, instead of individual nodes, so we can be notified with a parse fails;  Throw wrapped exception if we sense that a parse error has occured.
I don't think there are any real changes here.
Notify if parse fails.  Handle wrapped exceptions.
Better error reporting when parse fails.
Added WrappedException
Try to fully unwrap the WrappedRuntimeException.
Count all selected children
Fix when pushing and popping context markers
Make sure that the priority of the best matched pattern is set.

Fixed problem (again) with notification being correctly handled from a parser error.  Also, added loops to waits until when the child count is required.  Also, moved notification from Parent#setComplete to the SourceTreeHandler's ContentHandler methods.
Implement new extension handling mechanism

msg: Implement new extension handling mechanism

Allow JAVA_HOME to have directories with spaces in the
directory name.
Fix string equal compare from == to equals and clean up unneeded imports.
Correct order of arguments to isAssignableFrom
Implement function-available and element-available; clean up javadoc
Implement function-available, element-available, processElement; clean up javadoc

Changed how "trax.properties" is accessed.  See note on Xalan list.
 Moved transformation to secondary thread, and parser to main thread.
 Use "http://xml.apache.org/xslt/sourcebase" to set base URL for input source.

Removed import statements for org.apache.xml.serialize, use transition
instead.

( it used to compile fine if xerces and xml.serialize was in classpath,
doesn't work if another parser is used )
Added Gary L Peskin's extension files.

Like in xalan1, use dynamic class loading to load the BSF extension
handler. This allow xalan2 builds without BSF in classpath, while
allowing to use BSF when available.

Right now Xalan2 builds with no external dependency ( only standard
interfaces and it's own code ).
Allow component element with no content; remove experimental reflection code.
Remove BSF compile-time dependency; fix compile.trax
Minor fix - removed "final" on fields that are modified.
Make sure URI is not null.
Fix compile.trax

getAssociatedStylesheets and processMultiple should now work, enabling processing of xml-stylesheet PIs.
Processing of LRE as Stylesheet now better, xsl attribute excluded, xsl attributes are now properly applied to stylesheet, and other attributes applied to the LRE.
Xalan-J book for website.

1. Modified compile target to explicitly include entire source
    tree, except xalan-J 1 compatability classes, and to
    explicitly copy .properties  and .res files to build tree.
2. Completed the site target (for building website doc).
3. Changed javadocs target to include public members.
Make sure upper level elements are being properly overiden for imported and included stylesheets.
Make sure code is thread safe when getting a template
Ignore "feature not supported" exceptions, in case other parsers are used.

Handle case where prefix attribute is specified but there is no
corresponding namespace declaration.

Sandbox does not permit use of
   SerializerFactory.getSerializer("HTML").
So replace (FOR "priming pump" and performing transformation) with
    new org.apache.xml.serialize.transition.HTMLSerializer().
adjusted applet archive setting.

Removed reference to a copy of the applet on a Domino server,
and added info about where to put xalan.jar and xerces.jar.
Make sure we can get to parent of attribute nodes
doc updates for xalan-j 2.
XercesJ V1.2 (9/1/00 3:34pm)

Fix: if XSLTResultTarget is created with a File argument, we need
to return the right CharacterStream - TransformerImpl calls
getByteStream or getCharacterStream and both are null if file
is used ( resulting in a NPE in BaseMarkupSerializer.setOutputStream ).

I also changed the fields of trax.Result to protected - it is very
confusing to have the same field name in XSLTResultTarget and Result (
and it have unexpected effects ).

Major rewrite of ResultTreeHandler class, to make it more understandable, and to fix the bug where prefix events were not being generated correctly.
Several bugs related to whitespace before the XML decl were fixed in the process.
Also, fixed bug where string conversion of result tree fragments were being done with the XML serializer, instead of the Text serializer.

msg: Removed StylesheetSpec, which got in there somehow, from the compatibility stuff.
Check for null prefix in startPrefixMapping, and set it to "", for default prefix.
Fix problem with swallowing a char when buffer is full
Remove SimpleRedirect -- use org.apache.xalan.xslt.Process

Added public serializeXPathResultNode(Node n) to
serialize each of the nodes in a node-set returned by
an XPath expression.  This method wraps the protected
serializeNode(Node n) method, which uses a switch statement
to handle different node types. Not all node types are included,
and the default behavior does nothing, so I changed default
to getNodeValue, and send the String if any to the characters()
method. This handles attribute nodes, which were not handled
previously.

Used by the ApplyXPath sample.

Use the new serializeXPathReturnNode() I just added
to the BaseMarkupSerializer. This sample now provides
what looks like complete coverage for serializing XPath results.
Added ClonerToResultTree.
Removed elem param to ClonerToResultTree, since it is no longer needed.
Call isDefinedNSDecl for an attribute before adding it.

ensurePrefixIsDeclared fixed, so that it uses the raw name (duh...)
Added a check for ns decls that were already added, to try to fix problem
when RTFs are added that end up having redundent namespaces.  To no avail.
Need to clean up attribute setting in general to make it
more structured.
Added a compile-time debug flag.
Removed ElemTemplateElement param and member var, as it is no longer needed.

Renamed nodeset() function to asNodeIterator, and changed it a bit
to test for NodeList.
As per Gary Peskin's note on xalan-dev.
Initialize extension declarations in included stylesheets.
Adjusted "book" file names: xalan-jlocal.xml and xalan-jsite.xml.
Cleanup of "distribution" book vs. "site" book
Javadoc corrections per what we are including with Xalan-J 2.
Fix typo. Wrong loop variable used.
Sort templates by priority first, then by document order
Output META tag after HEAD tag for HTML output
Javadoc package-level and 2 interface-level comments.
Package-level javadoc comments for SAX.
Package-level javadoc comment for serializer.
Review draft for Xalan-J 2.0.D01
Review draft for Xalan-J 2.0.D01

1. Changed FileWriter to FileOutputStream
2. Added readme.html for distribution.
Changed FileWriter to FileOutputStream
Revised per comments from Shane.
Corrected spelling error (for Javadoc)
Revised Javadoc comment (per Dave Marston).
Revised Javadoc comment (per Dave Marston).
Move ExpressionContext from org.w3c.xslt to org.apache.xalan.extensions
Removed message in compile about compitaiblity classes.
Removed nodeset method (not yet functional).
Removed org.w3c.xslt package from javadoc.
Release notes and note about new contributors.
Final draft (I hope) for Xalan-J 2.0.D01.
Build template list by priority then document order. Misc changes to be able to get a template score for both step and union patterns.
bool() function should always return true.
Revised per Shane's review comments.
Corrected spelling errors.

1. Added bug on stylesheet PIs
2. Fixed TraceListener example.
Fixed typographical errors in text associated with a link.
Fixed TraceListener example.

Fix NodeIteratorWrapper to properly return NodeIterator with just
a single root node.

Clean up convert() method so all conversions are now done and done properly.
Still need to work on scoring for Object -> Object conversions.
Implement nodeset extension function.

1. Removed stylesheet PI bug.
2. Put absolute URI into stylesheet PI example and added
info on using command-line utility.
Changed the default indent amount to zero... for optimization purposes.
Changed parameters to cloneToResultTree, in conjunction with changes to that method.
Added feature for NodeTestFilter, so the walkers can use this instead of doing an instanceof.
Added isCompiledTemplate() method.
Pass one less parameter to avt.evaluate.
Pass m_doc directly from getOwnerDocument, instead of getDocumentImpl.
In getFirstChild, use hasChildNodes instead of getChildCount, which solves the last incrementality bug that I know of.

Only notify every 10 events or so (this number needs to be controleable by an application).
When the parse thread is done use the join() function to block until the transform thread is complete.

Massive rewrite, simplifies template matching.  Now, sort the pattern to assocations lists in priority
and document order, then add clones of the wildcard associations to each
association list.  This allows us to pattern match through only one list, and
quit when the first match is found (since the priorities can be statically determined).
For now, do not warn about conflicts... this will be added as an option
later (if the option is on, it will be at the expense of performance).
Functionality moved from inner class in TemplateList.
Use buffer pool, create buffers instead of getting them as params.
Don't pass new string buffer to avt, use StringBuffer pools.
Don't pass new string buffer to avt.
Remove isDot optimization, generally clean up the code.
Changed params to cloneToResultTree, in accordance to changes made to that method.
Added isCompiledTemplate function.
Moved extensions from NodeSetOperations into Extensions.
Call compose() method on the TemplateList, so that it can insert the wildcard associations into the associations table.
Changed getDefaultXXXRules to final.
Set S_DEBUG to true if a listener is added.
Rip out strip whitespace stuff, decrease number of parameters, since they weren't all used.
Defensive check for null template.
Added serializer property.
Reduce method calling vs. property access.

Changed some method calling to property access on queued events.
Pass false instead of true for flush for the default startPrefix mapping,
which seemed to fix the namespace bug (more testing needed).
Changed the m_recursionLimit variable to package private, so it can be accessed by the TranformerImpl in time-critical loops.

Used StringBuffer pooling, ResultTreeHandler pooling.
Changed pushes of current context node and template to single node list with pushPair and popPair methods.
Other minor changes.
String buffer pool for pooling StringBuffers.
Added methods for using as a stack, including a pair stack.
Default to return false from setFeature.
Comment out traceMethodCalls.
Remove line break normalization.  Ain't worth it.
Cosmetic changes only.
Optimize entity lookup for first 256 characters.
Very slightly optimize a loop.
Use StringBuffer pool.
Use a side index instead of pushing element frame objects.  Big improvement.
Make a bunch of methods final.  Use NodeVectors instead of stacks for context node stack.

Optimize some searches based on an compile-time analysis of the pattern.
Other minor optimizations also.
Make countPredicates public.
Added toString method, that will return the string representation of the pattern.
Added calcScore method for compile time determination, which assigns a value of SCORE_OTHER.

Various optimizations, including the direct use of the DOM2 namspace and local
name functions.  We'll have to see if I get in big trouble for this.
Don't match on the Document node for show_all.
Overall checkin for optimization effort.
Param/variable without content or select attribute now assigns value of empty string.

Added nodeset example and some preliminary info on use of the
new http://xml.apache.org/xalan namespace.
I think I got in trouble... adding back in use of DOMHelper functions for namespace and name.
Updates on Xalan namespace per info form Gary Peskin.
Implement evaluate extension function.

Added FastStringBuffer class, since StringBuffer is pretty sad for reuse.
Optimized loop in getTemplates so it doesn't do the pushes and pops of the context inside the loop.
Added mssing resources element!!
Beefed up nodeset description and example.
Fix up base to an absolute file URL if both uri and base are relative.
Send true for element flush for startPrefixMapping.  This fixes namespace25.

Make the m_schema non-static, since it holds processors that
hold state, and are therefore not threadsafe.  Work on this down the line.

Updated to use org.apache.xml.serialize.transition in place of the
Xerces package.
Warning about order of xalan.jar and xerces.jar on classpath.
Added note about how to enable indenting.
Avoid returning null, so servlet can run with lib.sql.
Oops, forgot the mode test.
Added note about org.apache.trax.Examples

1. Updated ref to new serializer packages.
2. Added more visible "alpha release" to release notes.
link to docs/whatsnew.html
Updated keyfile to contain group's public key.
Puts readme.xml in root.
Updated to use new trax package.
Fixed zip and tar to include base dir.
bsfengines.jar no longer used.
Removed refs to compat.excludes files.

Rearranged javadocs class so do not attempt to place patterns.xml
before apidocs/org/apache/trax exists.
Corrected link to trax.
Added TraceListener and stylesheet PI samples.

msg: Updated version number.
Serializability clean-up and jarfile generation
Generate and reload .zip file containing serialized compiled stylesheet (and generated .classes to support it)

Update comments for new package; specify ElemExtensionCall;
evaluate attributes within current XPathContext.
Support for serializing stylesheets
Better documentation of compiled stylesheet sketch
Updated to use Ant 1.2.
Ant 1.2
Root element not used, so removed.
Output file name based on stylesheet system ID (w/ fallback)
Cleanup: Reloading bundle should yield a TraX Templates object, rather than exposing our internal Stylesheet.

Changed version to 2.0D02.  anticipating next developers release.
Note that the version reported for Alpha D01 is just 2.0.

Ant 1.2 javadoc task ignores destdir if doclet is set, so must
assign -d param directly to doclet.
Generalizing, esp. to deal with MSVJ++
Take advantage of generalized compilation routine
Oops. Wrong access on one method
Cleanup and documentation
Status message tweak
Fix argument class evaluation test.
Development version must be numeric.
Implement tokenize extension function.

Improved error reporting for java extension method errors.
Fixed scoring for non-XSLT object -> java object.
Made getTypeString() public to improve error reporting for java extension method errors.
Fixed some bugs with import\include.  JIndent formatting.

In addition to JIndent formatting:

Many fine-grained optimizations.

Change the Stree DOM to use linked references to first child and next and previous siblings, instead of arrays for child lists.  This follows much more naturally the way they are being accessed by the iterators, though perhaps at some expense for space.

The DocumentImpl node now holds a single character array for text.  Text nodes copy into that array, instead of each making a String object as soon as they are created.  A string is created upon demand.  With some transformations, this could actually mean more space taken, rather than less, though I think the net will be a gain for most transformations.  In the long run, the real solution is to be able to use the original array, and not make a copy at all.  We'll be working with the Xerces folks on this, and maybe try to push this onto the SAX standard.  Having to make a copy of the character data is a real nasty issue with the SAX spec.   And why-o-why doesn't Sun define a String object that can reference a character array, instead of having to copy?

Stree character nodes now implement a SaxEventDispatch interface.  Xalan asks the node if it implements this interface via the .supports method, and then calls dispatchSaxEvent(ContentHandler ch), allowing the text node to directly dispatch to the characters event, directly passing in the data from the character array in the DocumentImpl.

In addition to JIndent formatting:

Brought the central loop code for itterating over selections and applying templates to a function in ElemForEach, transformSelectedNodes.  Spent a fair amount of time optimizing this loop and making it as clean as possible.

transformSelectedNodes calls the dispatchSaxEvent directly when encountering a character node that doesn't have a template defined (and thus uses the default text template).  dispatchSaxEvent can be used in other places in the code, but right now it's only used in transformSelectedNodes.

various other finer grained optimizations, based on measurements from Rational Visual Quantify.

Major checkin that includes JIndent formatting.   See my note titled
"Optimizations, changes" on the xalan-dev list 10/30/2000 03:55 PM.

msg: Changed dev build number to 02
Fast iterator for "node()" selections.
Add NodeFilter.SHOW_DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT, for DocumentFragment compatibility.
Check for DocumentFragment for traversal.  Attributed to Gary L Peskin <garyp@firstech.com>.
In getRoot, use DocumentFragment as the root.  Attributed to Gary L Peskin <garyp@firstech.com>.
Use same head fetch for DocumentFragment as for Document.
Remove xml-space stuff, which is processed at the ElemTemplateElem level.  Attributed to Gary L Peskin <garyp@firstech.com>.
Have setXmlSpace use an int instead of a boolean, since it is an enumerated value.
Do a fireSelectedEvent immediatly after the selection (somehow this was removed).

For the selected method, if the type is an itterator, test for ContextNodeList.
If it is a ContextNodeList, do cloneWithReset.  Otherwise
simply spit out a message that says, can't do it.

In getSetterMethodName, hack the xml:space attribute to call setXmlSpace,
attributed to Gary L Peskin <garyp@firstech.com>.
Things to be done list.  All XalanJ2 developers should try and work off this list.
Generalize getSetterMethodName to handle attributes in xml: namespace.
Clean up double semicolon.
Implement document fragments to mirror documents.
Implement document fragments to mirror documents.
update to ant 1.2 in progress.

James Davidson, Rajiv Mordani, and myself got together last week at ApacheCon London to work on the TrAX proposal.  You can find the results of this work at http://xml.apache.org/trax/trax_10_30_00.zip (sorry about the apache address, it's all I have outside our firewall).

The highlights of the changes are:

1) Processor has been renamed to TransformerFactory, in order to match the javax.xml.parsers pattern.

2) Input and Result are defined with abstract interfaces (Source and Result) that are empty.  You must use a concrete implementation of these interfaces.

3) Three subpackages are defined: sax, dom, and stream. These implement the specifics for the given Source and Result types.  In addition, the sax package has a SAXTransformerFactory, SerializerHandler, and TransformerHandler.

4) The serializer package is gone (sorry, Assaf).  Instead, TransformerFactory now implements a newTransformer method that takes no arguments.  This method is defined to return a Transformer that does an identity copy from Source to Result.  With this, you can do everything the serializer interface did, and more.

5) The one thing I don't like much, is that TransformerFactory.newInstance no longer takes a string as an argument (which signified the type of TransformerFactory you want).  James used the same argument about this as he used about the DOM builder.  But, there are complicating factors, and it's better to be more simple now, and add this in later, if it is really needed.

6) The Features class contains URLs for all the supported types of features, i.e. DOM, SAX, etc.

7) Namespaced names (or Universal Names) are specified to be passed as {url}local-name.  While this is ugly, it's the only way to cleanly use existing Java classes like Properties that use the String class, and is easy enough to parse.  These are used both for output properties, and for variables.

I am pretty happy with this API at this point, though I'm sure it needs some polishing on details.  It lines up cleanly with the existing JSR63 transform stuff (a lot of the wording won't have to be changed), allows anybody to define a transformation from any object to any object (for instance, it will be easy to define a JDOM transformer),  supports different transformer models, is very powerful, yet is relatively simple for the job to be done.  I *think* Mike Kay will be pleased also, but he'll have to speak for himself.

A good place to start is the examples file.

Work to be done:

1) Documentation, both JavaDoc and the JSR doc (which James will do).
2) Rajiv needs to do some work on the TransformerFactory to bring it fully into line with javax.xml.parsers.
3) Respond to comments and requests for revisions.

msg:
TrAX (Transformations API for XML) changes.  The javax.xml.transform
package is the reborn TrAX.  Significant changes were needed in
the code because of the change of exception derivation and
Locator change, and also because the structure has indeed changed
a bit.  The code is still a little rough for the wear.  I'll work in the coming
days to polish it up.  Internally, the code still uses Assaf's OutputFormat,
but this should change to use the Properties bag.

Define services files for default settings of the JAX properties.

The ANT file needs to be updated to process these into the
JAR file.
Modified so the META-INF directory will be copied into the JAR.

Examples all seem to work, except the exampleXMLFilterChain
must use baz.xsl instead of foo.xsl, because of a bug that I have
not yet solved with threading and piped transforms.

msg: Moved getAssociatedStylesheet up from SAX level.
Moved getAssociatedStylesheet up to generic level.  added newTransformerHandler(Templates templates).
Removed decl handler stuff.

Added newTransformerHandler(Templates templates),
call second processFromNode method so that
m_DOMsystemID gets set.
Some experimentation with whitespace sensing in the characters event.
Documentation changes.
Documentation changes, changed setIDAttribute to only take id and element.
Remove commented section in startDocument.
Documentation changes, only pass ID and elem to setIDAttribute.
Param documentation should be complete for this class now.

Try identity comparison for OutputKeys first, before testing for equality.
Also, small exception handling fix.
Mainly fixes for exception handling.

Documentation.
Also, call setIDAttribute with only two args.

Add getOutputProperties.
Explain that Transformers may be reused.
Add exampleTransformerReuse.
Reset the document cache in reset.  Add getProperties.
Check for null reader and null error handler in warn and error functions.
Add reset method.
Check m_xpath for null also.
Do nested stack traces.
Add methods to save and set the search context of the stack.

Save the variable stack search context when initContext is called,
and restore the state every time next node is called.  Another performance
issue.
Modified to deal with the Manifest better
Moved from META-INF, which the build/jar doesn't like.
Moved "implement javax.trax interfaces" task to completed.
Javadoc fix, and distinction between javax.xml.parsers and javax.xml.transform
No longer used.
Added getURIResolver.
Minor JavaDoc change.
Minor JavaDoc change for getURIResolver.
Added getURIResolver method.
Fix so that if an extension element processes its children (like Redirect), xsl:fallback elements will by bypassed.
Clean up nodeset to handle any type of argument.  Fix javadoc.
Fix javadoc.
Javadoc fixes.

Make sure current node remains in the same place when getCurrent is called.
This needs more work, I think, and the fix should really be made
lower down.
Javadoc comments.
Javadoc cleanup
Quick fix to use new TrAX.
Documentation changes!!!
Don't use child iterator if predicate is used.
Fixes for variable resolution.
Minor typo change to javadoc.

Change global variables and parameters list so that they are only
one list, and store composed global variables and params as a vector
instead of a hashtable, so that order is preserved.
More Documentation changes!!!

Fixes in servlet target to get everything needed in
.\build\xalanservlet.jar

Fixed problem where exception thrown from getFeature was not being
caught, which kept Crimson from working.  Also, in DOMBuilder, don't
call setAttributeNS for an xmlns: attribute because Crimson doesn't
like it.  Things should work OK with Crimson now, at least with the
TrAX examples smoke test.
Just added commented out crimson lines.

Cleaned up logic to build template chains.  Added comments.
Enforce document order rules.

Change getWhatToShow to return a more accurate NodeFilter for node(),
Cleaned up handing of text nodes.

Removed special case coding in executeStep no longer needed
due to refined NodeFilter.

Explicitly test for child::node() before considering ChildIterator.
The old test for a NodeFilter doesn't work anymore because
getWhatToShow now returns more specific information.
Added else to eliminate unnecessarily executing if statement.
Resynchronizing with trax changes
Added java doc comments.

Fixed variable problems.  Including forward references with globals,
and QNames with variables now work.  I don't thing that cyclic
variables are tested for yet.
Add duplicate variable name problem

Small change in Examples - catch and display exceptions for each
individual example. ( if one fails, the following examples will still
be executed). Also display the "chained" exception, as most of the time
it is the real source of truble.

Sync with the javax.xml tree.

As sugested, the cached value for factory will be used after the
system property, because the user might change the system property.

We still cache the value read from java.home/lib/jaxp.properties and
from CLASSPATH because both involve expensive file operations.
Correct and cleanup recomposeImports() to generate m_globalImportList with correct precedence.

Fixes to accomodate new trax/serializer/etc.,
and Ritesh Kumar's fix for detecting and using the correct
server port.
Moved "Catch multiple definitions" to high priority.
In TrAX, changed get/setBaseID to get/setSystemID.

Added a default for the TransformImpl.

This avoids problems with ClassLoaders and broken builds. It also
allows xalan to work even if services/ is not present.

Scott, I think you forgot to check in some changes in Source ( the systemId),
I can't build right now.

Changes to TrAX:
  Moved OutputKeys to generic level.
  Added ErrorListener.
  set/getSystemID on Source and Result interfaces.
  Nix SerializerHandler, define PI strings on Result object.
  Define null node on result as implementation will create Document.
  Major javaDoc improvements, including package overviews.
  URLResolver example in TrAX examples.
  Other TrAX examples added.

Moved org.apache.serialize files to org.apache.xalan.serialize.
Major changes for ErrorListener, all exceptions thrown are Transformer
exceptions except when SAX interfaces require the SAX exception.

Two regressions caused to conformance tests that I haven't
tracked down yet.

Added XMLFilter newXMLFilter(Templates templates),
Made both versions of newXMLFilter throw
TransformerConfigurationException.
Removed JavaDoc part about doing identity comparisons.
Javadoc updates.
Javadoc updates.

In getBaseIdentifier(), try to use the
m_baseIdentifiers stack, and only use
the locators stack if this is empty.

In recomposeOutput, fix it so the call to getOutput gets the output
from the stylesheet passed in, not the "this" output format.
Fixes impincl\impincl01 test.

Commented out garyp code of 2000/11/2.  The current node should
not be reset with a normal clone, but should only be reset with
a reset operation, and the clone should not be marked as fresh.
Catch and disallow use of circular variables plus miscellaneous changes to error reporting and exception handling. Also change code to use SourceLocator and not SaxSourceLocator.
Javadoc update.
Javadoc update.

The last() function was trying to turn the context list into
a cached list on the fly, which causes nasty problems from inside
a predicate.  So, I commented that code out (but left it there for
reference), and use a clone to get the count from the current
position.  I then defined a set/getLast method on ContextNodeList,
and store the count there.
Bugs from Shane TrAX API testing.

Changed TemplateHandler#setSystemID to TemplateHandler#setSystemId.
Delete the Features class, and define FEATURE variables on
the Source and Result derived classes, as well as on SAXTransformerFactory
and also define FEATURE_XMLFILTER on SAXTransformerFactory.
The overview is now broken from the javax.xml.transform package doc.
Other minor javadoc fixes.

Updated for TrAX changes:
Changed TemplateHandler#setSystemID to TemplateHandler#setSystemId.
Delete the Features class, and define FEATURE variables on
the Source and Result derived classes, as well as on SAXTransformerFactory
and also define FEATURE_XMLFILTER on SAXTransformerFactory.
Removed Features.java and added overview.html.
Minor javadoc changes.
Fix ouput for disabled output escaped text
Bug fixes for SPRs that have to do with output properties and param setting.
All SPRs pended.
Two reports from Mikael Stldal <d96-mst@d.kth.se>.
Wrap setAutoCommit with try, and catch SQLException if thrown.
Don't suppress output of whitespace before the first element.

Use "" instead of null, as Xerces likes "" for the
name of the default namespace.  Fix attributed
to "Steven Murray" <smurray@ebt.com>.

Add document order indexes to ElemTemplateElements, as per
discussions with Gary P., and pass them into TemplateList#setTemplate.

Updated to new DOM API, so we match with Xerces 1.2.1.  Updated
Xalan code to use isSupported instead of supports.
Updated to use new TrAX.
Xerces 1.2.1
No longer in use.

Changed TransformerHandler#setBaseID to setSystemId (sorry), and
added getSystemId to both TransformerHandler and TemplatesHandler.
Fixed setURIResolver comments to accurately reflect use in the
document() function vs. xsl:include/xsl:import.
Added trax material to javadoc target.

The trax package.html files and an overview file are generated
during the build from trax.xml.
Fixed assign in setInputSource.
Append current text to text of previously created text node from the last Characters

When the node being copied is a root node (and thus no node
is created), call super.execute so that the ElemUse stuff gets
applied to the containing element.  This fixes bugs in attributeset 27
and 29.
Loose extra printStackTrace in processFromNode.

Replaced javax.xml.parsers ( wich used to represent JAXP1.0 ) with the
latest JAXP1.1.

Now both javax.xml.transform and javax.xml.parsers correspond with the
latest spec.

Fixed the trax example to use the latest spec.

Also, use JAXP1.1 to get the XMLReader.

Tested it with both crimson and xerces - just include the parser you want
in CLASSPATH and it'll work !

Updated xerces.jar - now it's the latest ( as of Nov 15, 19:17 PST ).

The new xerces.jar implements JAXP1.1.

From strange reasons, the default for namespaceAware is false ( used to
be true in previous versions ) - you need to explicitely set this to
true to use it with xalan.

Use JAXP1.1 to get  the XMLReader - there are 5 files where a new
XMLReader is created, and now we use SAXParserFactory to get
it.

We do check for NoSuchMethodError - that means the code will work even
if you have an old JAXP1.0 parser ( assuming you have the old parser
at the beginning of CLASSPATH, same for JAXP1.0 - since xalan
includes the latest ). Probably that will disapear when no longer needed.

I tested with crimson, xerces ( latest - JAXP1.1 ), xerces ( old - JAXP1.0),
it seems to work fine.

Also, in StylesheetHandler, add an extra check for NPE - during debug
it happened to have an unchecked null ( and it can't hurt to check )
Implement entity handling.
Removed commented crimson lines.
Javadoc correction for empty constructor.

1. Fixed ApplyXSLTListener constructor to match DefaultErrorHandler.
2. Use default OutputFormatExtended if get null from stylesheet.

Uncommented code for check for name, so that keys work when there
are multiple declarations.

Uncommented code for check for name, so that keys work when there
are multiple declarations.

Add fast iterator for simple child tests without predicates.
Tried to do .detach on iterators but ran into too many regressions,
so I commented code out.

Commented out samples task -- needs work to catch up to
new TrAX -- servlet and applet are working.

Fix name and namespace functions so they don't return names for "#xxx" names.
Fix version system property so that it returns the version of the spec we conform to.
Fix terminate attribute on xsl:message.
Don't put out warning prefix for a warning in the default error listener.
Updated to use new TrAX.
Removed space in front of the string that caused an hour of work.
Updated to use new TrAX.
Process templates and whitespace stripping with proper precedence.

Changes made to TrAX API in response to Sun evaluation:
StreamSource/Result now have File constructors and setSystemID(File).
set/getCharacterStream and set/getByteStream now changed
to set/getReader/Writer and set/getInput/OutputStream.
Added getCause stuff to TransformerException.
Added clearParameters method.
Updated to use new TrAX. Doesn't really work with new Serializer!
Updated to use new TrAX.
Include all samples in samples target.
Updated to use new TrAX. Only works for serializing entire document.
Updated to use new TrAX. Only works for serializing entire document.
Updated to latest status.  Reformated a bit, to produce status reports.

Javadoc complete.  Some of these files got wacked by JBuilder's
trimming of trailing spaces (which I didn't realize was on), so if
you need to do diffs, you should use a diff problem that can turn
off comparisons based on trailing spaces.

Javadoc update.  Some of these files got wacked by JBuilder's
trimming of trailing spaces (which I didn't realize was on), so if
you need to do diffs, you should use a diff problem that can turn
off comparisons based on trailing spaces.

Made FUNC_KEY_STRING public, so it can be accessed for recursive key evaluation check.

Re-added package files.  Not sure why these were removed, but
I think the HTML versions should stay check in, if possible.
Explain cleaned-up extension support.

Moved the org.apache.xalan.utils package to org.apache.xml.utils,
in response to a design concern that, since XPath uses the utils
stuff, this package should not be in the Xalan package.  Also moved
a bunch of the org.apache.xalan.res classes to org.apache.xml.utils.res,
so that the base internationalization stuff can be in a neutral place.
The utils stuff still has a few dependencies on the xalan package,
but we'll be fixing this over the next couple of weeks.

Fix check for namespace nodes.  Avoid object creation for empty string.
If no ErrorListener is set, obtain one from the owner, if available.  Otherwise, create a default one.

Since the free method is not synchronized, do setLength before
the object is freed.  Fix attributed to Peter Speck <speck@ruc.dk>.

Check for circular includes as well as import.

Change Key() to incrementally build a table with key values and iterators. With this change, we will only walk through the source tree once per key name definition.

Namespace aliases should now work.  1) now build composed namespace
alias table indexed by URL and with a value of the namespace
element, 2) in ElemTemplateElement#resolvePrefixTables insert the
aliased (result) namespace instead of the namespace, 3) in ElemLiteralResult
augment resolvePrefixTables by fixing up the m_namespace and
m_rawName members to use the result prefix and URL, and do the
same to the AVTs.  I think ElemLiteralResult is the only place that
this fixup should be done.

The namespace tests that use alias don't match because we now
properly use the result prefix.  These tests will need to be fixed.

msg:
Deleted OutputFormat and OutputFormatExtended in favor of new
OutputProperties class.  Default properties are now resource based.
Serializers should be pluggable, though this hasn't been tested.
Entity references are now specified through resources, and a bitmap
is built for fast test to determine special status of character.
indent-amount and URI character escaping can now be controled
via xalan attributes on xsl:output.
Just removed import of OutputFormat.

Deleted OutputFormat and OutputFormatExtended in favor of new
  OutputProperties class.  Default properties are now resource based.
  Serializers should be pluggable, though this hasn't been tested.
  Entity references are now specified through resources, and a bitmap
  is built for fast test to determine special status of character.
  indent-amount and URI character escaping can now be controled
  via xalan attributes on xsl:output.

Moved xsl:output and serialization stuff to completed.  Assigned the
internal jaxp DOM needs to be STree to Myriam.
Next stuff on my list is the axes stuff.

Added trax to samples.

Add code to fix up the property keys and values if the ":" is not being escaped and if the property name specified is not the appropriate constant. Also allow System properties to overide properties specified in the output properties files

Remove Recomposable family of classes.  They are no longer needed
since all recomposable elements now extend ElemTemplateElement.

Don't add indent/line break if element is empty, to be consistent
with XT and SAXON.  As per discussions with Paul and Dave today.
Same fix has been made in XalanC.

For some VERY strange reason, the end element was passing an
empty string for the namespace and local name.  This is fixed, and
it addresses a bug which the Cocoon folks were having.

Resolve xalan:entities attribute value to absolute URL.

Do reset after transformation, so the transformer will be set up for

Respect precedence levels when composing xsl:output elements.

Bring cdata-section-elements processing into standards conformance.
Fixed the media-type defaults, and also set the version default for HTML.
Set the encoding for the text method to be the system default.
Set the encoding default if file.encoding is not available to be UTF8.
Rather than popping the stack each time, use an index, so that cloned walkers will work correctly.
Put defensive code in for negative predicate index.
Some javadoc added.

Add value to the itterator to mark the start of where the waiters
should be looked at.  In the walker, set the bottom of the waiters
list to be the current size of the stack when executing a predicate,
then restore it on return.  This fixes a bug when executing the
last() function inside a predicate in a walker that has to wait for
the parent walker to walk past it.  Fixes test axes91.
Just some added javadoc.

For namespace alias, use the styelsheet prefix instead of the result
prefix, as per XSL WG decision.

Use 0 for zero, instead of #(0).  To match test suite.  I think this will
be resolved in the XSLT 1.0 erreta.
Tweak file:xxx munging.  Wish I didn't have to do this.

Fix LANG_BUNDLE_NAME to be the right name, which fixes several
tests that access the bundles.

Set the carriage return as special, and normalize the
cr/lf in attributes, since the parser doesn't seem to
do it.

Move the reassignment of member variables from clone to cloneWithReset.
This fixes test position56.

Enabled Scaron entity, for the sake of
passing the conformance tests.  I am
told that Netscape does not support this.

Set the PrefixResolver to the template being matched before executing
the match expression.  This is needed so that XSLT functions,
like xsl:key, can get to their template context.  This fixes test idkey03.

Clone the key iterators before returning.   Have Myriam check that
this is really what we want (I can't see how it isn't).  Fixes test idkey01.

Remove reverence to old lotus namespace, and use the constant
value for the apache extensions address.
Don't add duplicate nodes.  Fixes test select59.

Re-worked analysis in Walker factory so that it is more sane.  It now
uses a bit scheme instead of enumerated values for the analysis.
Added DescendantIterator which optimizes "//foo" patterns as well
as "descendant-or-self::foo", "descendant::foo", and ".//foo" patterns.
ToDo: It would probably be nice to add handling of "//foo/@attr"
patterns also, since the attributes do not have the danger of overlapping
in document order, as child patterns do.
Moved optimization of "//foo" patterns to completed.

Separated DocumentFragmentImpl from DocumentImpl.
DocumentFragmentImpl no longer extends DocumentImpl.  Instead, both now extend a new class DocImpl.
This allows DocumentImpl to enforce the "one document element" constraint of the DOM and implement all of the "create" methods while not forcing DocumentFragmentImpl to do the same thing.
We now allow RTFs to have multiple element and text children per the XSLT spec.
The common DocImpl superclass allows the root of the source tree to be either a Document or DocumentFragment.

nextSibling should not return a value for attributes.  I'm not sure
why it was??

Fixed support for following sibling from an attribute, and adapted
XalanC method for following axes after an attribute, though both
XT and SAXON give different results.  Xalan treats the children of the
owning element as if they were siblings following the attribute, which
the are in a sense.  XT and SAXON process everything following the
owning element.  Since self, following, descendants, preceding, and
ancestors are supposed to encompass the entire document, and attributes
obviously can't have descendants, and the children of the owning
element clearly don't occur before the attributes, I think Xalan
is right.
Don't append a space after the last property value
Improved prefix-to-namespace lookup (trust the DOM), some docs
fixed typo in property name.
When setting an output property, don't overide existing properties from the stylesheet
fixed typo in property name.

2.getContentType() can now be restored to its previous form;

been fixed. It no longer returns a value if the stylesheet does

Fixed regression that occured when the Arg#equality function
was removed.

Fixed bug where the waiting list of walkers were not being cloned.  Fix
was made by defining a cloneDeep function on AxesWalker, and
handing it in a Vector to which is added the original-clone pairs.
Each clone operation checks to see if it is on the list, and, if so,
uses the already cloned object, otherwise it clones itself and adds
its pair to the list.  This has more expense than I would like, but
is safe.
Also made many member variables transient, in order to work towards
the ability to serialize the iterators (this was done so that a given
iterator could be serialized and then checked against another
serialization after an clone and execute operation to see
what had changed.  This debugging technique kind of worked!)

Remaining javadoc work for org.apache.xpath.functions.
Javadoc.

Set the variable context in setRoot, since it may be executed during
a cloneWithReset operation, in which case the variable context
is not set by LocPathIterator's nextNode.  This bug was uncovered
by fixing the deep clone operation, at which point the filter walker
may not have been cloned.

Get the qname from the arg and do the compare with that, so we
don't have to do the extra instance of in Arg#equals.
Java doc.
Java docs.
Javadoc work.
Not currently being used, so I'm removing the heap classes.

Removed the NEEDSDOC from these.  Joe can finish these sometime
at his convenience.
Finished up remaining javadoc holes.
Minor javadoc fix.
Moved javadoc task to completed.

Add new PredicatedNodeTest base class for both the LocPathIterator
and the AxesWalker.  This helps break up AxesWalker a bit, and
allows optimized location path iterators to have predicates.
Adapted optimized iterators to this new scheme.
Also fixed bad bit test for creating childWalkerMultiStep, which
may have been the source of the performance degragation reported.
Also set the waiting list in LocPathIterator to null by default.
Also made it so that, for AxesWalker#cloneDeep, don't pass a
vector in (and don't create one in the first place) if the waiting
list is null.  Also fixed childWalkerMultiStep so that it can be built
for as long as the steps are down pointing and one level traversing.
Just removed unneeded import of AxesWalker.

Use PredicatedNodeTest instead of AxesWalker to get the current
location path iterator.

Move the test for NodeFilter.SHOW_ALL to the two argument
execute, so it can be called directly from the PredicatedNodeTest.
Fix compose of cdata-section-elements to work with Myriam's change to revision 1.6
Applets are set to look for xalan.jar and xerces.jar in the bin directory.
Added get-todo-list.html
Added ToDo listl
Cleanup tasks on servlet and applet.

Rewritten to use TrAX interfaces. To avoid IE security restrictions,
TrustedAgent in separate Thread used to get documents
(using Transformer identity transformation).
Changed alpha to beta.
Added method to get the table of available elements.

Changed the reference to XSLTSchema to hashtable of available elements.
This should fix some of the serialization problems.
Get the hashtable of available elements instead of the XSLTSchema, from the stylesheet.
XML source for appletXMLtoHTML
Fixed typo.
Update version number.
Updates for beta release.
Updates for beta release.
Fix code so that it uses the XMLReader provided when one is provided
Added evaulate and tokenize extension functions.
Replaced with DOM2DOM

Commented out cloneWithReset in favor of the reset function which
is being called from the location path iterator.

Call nextNode in the reset of the contained iterators, so that getCurrentNode
will return something in UnionPathIterator#nextNode.  This was the
cause of the problems that looked like an xsl:key problem
 that Davanum reported.

Warning about using DOMResult more than once without doing
a setNode().
Version 2.0.D04
Pad single hex values in URLs with zero.
Updates for beta release.
Updates for beta release.
Make hex string for generate id upper case.

Back on the air, updated to conform to new Composed Stylesheet logic.
(No other new function yet.) Seems to pass about as many of
the conformance tests as the interpreted code does, though I'm not
sure it's passing the same ones.
Updates for beta release.
Remove Catch IOException clause.  It would never be reached.
Updates for beta release.
Patch from Steven Serocki: Fix deadlock with getLocale() in ElemNumber.
Updated version number to 2.0.D04
Correction in our reference to the test suite per Dave Marston.

One-line workaround for a bug in the parser. Crimson seems to return
null for attrUri instead of "".

Fix for variables out of context. Basically, searchstart need to be adjusted when variables or params are added because of an xsl:call-template or xsl:apply-templates. Note that Scott needs to do some additional work in this area!!!

Suppress addition of whitespace when outside a document
element, to avoid DOM006 Hierarchy request errors.
Added "-flavor d2d" for testing of dom-to-dom transformations.

From Rajiv Mordani <Rajiv.Mordani@eng.sun.com>: 		 I have made some changes to the javadocs in the transform package
and also added getDOMImplementation to the DocumentBuilderFactory (was
discussed earlier in the expert group but forgot to include it).

Adapted Joe's work on fixing the problem with multiple text events
appending to a node, but the node being accessed by the transformer
thread before the appends are complete.  Now the node is created
but not appended until setPreviousIsText is called.  Also, the transformer
now properly sends an end document event when an RTF transform is
done, so that setPreviousIsText(false) is called in endDocument.

Changed variable stack to be a stack of frames, which makes
everything a hell of a lot easier.  When a frame is first pushed, it
is a static empty frame, and then is switched to a real frame if
a parameter or variable is pushed.

Modified Myriams setting of searchStart a bit, so the nested variables at
inside a variable at the top level work now.

When pushing params, now just keep track of the param declaration
context and the reference context, and just change the start search
inside the loop, instead of doing two loops.
Add space if find "?>" inside PI data.
Updated version to 2.0.D5
Updated version to 2.0.D05

In addAttribute, don't do ensurePrefixIsDeclared  for the xmlns
name itself.
Uncomment code that checks if the prefix is declared already
before adding the attribute.
This fixes bug with duplicate xmlns attributes reported
by "Jarno Elovirta" <jarno@elovirta.com>
on 12/20/2000 02:35 AM.  May cause fairly minor performance
regression.
Added extract from SPR database to our doc build.
BUGs is now build dynamically from xml-xalan/java/bugs-j-2.xml.
Rearrangment of BUGS.
Made set/getLexicalHandler public.
Call JAXP to get the reader, which was not being done!
Removed a couple of debug statements I had left in by mistake.
Added accessors for the param variable flag.
Changed getParamVariable to getParamArg.

Set the isParam flag to false.  In the variable stack, only get variables
that are *not* params.  This all keeps us from executing parameters
that are not declared.  See test variable 26.
Added remarkParams function.

The parameters now work like this:
1) Before an apply-template loop (i.e. outside the loop)
push all the params on
the current frame.  Each Arg is marked as being a param.
2) When ElemParam executes, if a real parameter is found on
the stack, mark it as *not* being a param, else execute it as a
variable for the default value.
3) When the variable stack looks for a variable, it doesn't
return those marked as a parameter.  Thus it won't return
parameters that are marked as parameters, given #2.
4) after the template has executed, remark all the parameters
as parameters, and go back to #2 in the next itteration of the
loop.

Absolutize the URL for unparsed entity URIs.  From the sped:
"The root node has a mapping that gives the URI for each unparsed entity declared in the document's DTD. The URI is generated from the system identifier and public identifier specified in the entity declaration. The XSLT processor may use the public identifier to generate a URI for the entity instead of the URI specified in the system identifier. If the XSLT processor does not use the public identifier to generate the URI, it must use the system identifier; if the system identifier is a relative URI, it must be resolved into an absolute URI using the URI of the resource containing the entity declaration as the base URI [RFC2396]."
Note that this will cause problems with the testsuite.  We should
probably try and do something with the public ID to avoid this, both in the
code and in the test?

Add dfactory.setNamespaceAware(true); to d2d flavor, so it will
work correctly!!!

Moved unparsed entity task to completed, and added two performance
related tasks, and one error handling task to be done for beta2.

Changed the composed variables to non-transient.  I'm not totally
sure why Gary had these listed as transient.  Perhaps he was thinking
that we would recompose on readObject?  I was thinking the opposite,
that we would throw away all uncomposed stuff if you serialized.
In any case, this seems to make serialization work OK, though
surely not optimized for storage space!!!

Small, ugly hack in getClassForName to substitute the
"org.apache.xalan.xslt.extensions.Redirect" with
"org.apache.xalan.lib.Redirect", for backwards compatibility
with XalanJ1 stylesheets.

Transforms bugs.xml (extracted from SPR db) to BUGS
for inclusion in readme.xml.
Updates for beta release.
Reverted to bugs.xml
Not sure how this got purged, but here it is again.
Fixed nasty bug where an arg was being set in the stack, instead of the frame.
Try not to check for arg.isParamVar() is global var.
Added note on handling of cr-lf in output.
Added note on handling of cr-lf in output.
Removed the now dumb check for global var stack in getVars.
No real changes, just changes in the commented debugging stuff.
Quick editorial pass.
Clarification on setting output properties.

Added gary's tasks from his mail, added NodeSet compatibility task,
added some other tasks.
Added tast for architecture documentation for myself.
Editorial correction.
Final update for beta release.

In pushOrReplaceVariable, check if elem frame is the empty stack
frame, and call allocateCurrentFrame if it is.

In pushOrReplaceVariable, move check of empty frame to before
the loop.
Add check for isParamVar so we don't replace a non-param var.

On reset, force the stack size to 1, so that everything's correct
on entry again.
Javadoc cleanup.

Add paragraph about XSLT extensions in general per suggestion from John Gentilin <johnglinux@eyecatching.com>.
Updated url for Dave Pawson's FAQ.

Add conftest, examplestest, and smoketest targets, to call
the test package's build.xml, after the fashion of minitest.
This obviously needs more work to call the tests more easily, as
I would like to be able to call a still more extensive list of tests,
perhaps all of them for a test-fill target, which seems difficult right
now given the granularity of the tests.

Removed for now, to be added later.  These classes are non-functional
for the moment.
